item.title: Ticket #2186 (Trouble with V2 Editor Creating HyperLinks) closed
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
wontfix:

Related to an intentional TinyMCE setting change. The older setting caused more problems than this.

In my opinion this is not a bug. You should enter absolute URLs and not expect WordPress to do it for you.

If someone intends to write URL guessing code, they may reopen this.

item.title: Ticket #2186 (Trouble with V2 Editor Creating HyperLinks) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description: A temporary workaround is to type the _entire_ URL, including '​http://' and everything.

item.title: Ticket #2183 (get_post_meta bug) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description: Keywords changed

item.title: Ticket #2186 (Trouble with V2 Editor Creating HyperLinks) created
item.dc:creator: doc
item.description:
I posted this over in the forums on wordpress.org - ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/53373?replies=1

With no response after several days, I am suspicous that this must be due to a bug of some sort. Here is a reposted of the original item:

I upgraded two installations to version 2.0 yesterday. Only one small glitch and we were sailing. Well done development team.

However, I have noticed with one installation trouble creating links with the new Rich Text Editor (tinyMCE). Here's the scoop.

My site: www.mysite.com External site: www.externalsite.com

When I use the gui in the editor, it creates the following html code:

<a href="​http://www.mysite.com/wordpress/wp-admin/www.externalsite.com" target=_blank>foo bar</a>

Of course it should be:

<a href="​http://www.externalsite.com" target="_blank">foo bar</a>

I can always go to the html code to fix it manually, but that sort of undermines the whole reason of having a WYSIWYG editor! ;-) The weird thing is that on my other installation of WP2, this is not a problem. Anybody got any clues as to how I can track this down?

Thanks again to the development team for version 2. I didn't lose any of my sanity in this upgrade and that's good because there isn't much left!

item.title: admin-header2.diff.txt attached to Ticket #2184
item.dc:creator: MattRead
item.description: fix ajaxcat and regex

item.title: Ticket #2184 (newCatAddIn Javascript function tries to append a 'p' into a 'p' which ...) updated
item.dc:creator: MattRead
item.description:
Well there was another error after fixing that one. one of the RegEx that strips out line endings has the \l escape character. without the \l it works great, and it seems, from what I can find, that no browser supports \l anyway. So I submit a new diff that fixes both errors. Sorry ... should have done this the first time :)

admin-header2.diff.txt is the one!

item.title: Ticket #2185 (There should be a capability flag for the dashboard) created
item.dc:creator: whimsy
item.description:
On some multi-author blogs, lower-level authors don't need or want to see the dashboard.

Adding a "show dashboard" option to the list of capabilities would let me do what I want, and hide it from selected users. The default roles could all include this flag, and I could adjust them or make new roles using Owen's Role Manager Plugin.

item.title: admin-header.diff.txt attached to Ticket #2184
item.dc:creator: MattRead
item.description: fix ajaxcat

item.title: Ticket #2184 (newCatAddIn Javascript function tries to append a 'p' into a 'p' which ...) created
item.dc:creator: MattRead
item.description:
newCatAddIn Javascript function, which allows you to add categories via ajax, tries to append a paragraph (p) into a paragraph (p). Which causes an DOM error in Konqueror.

The simplest fix is to change the ajaxcat element to a 'span' as in the diff I will submit.

item.title: Ticket #2174 (Blockquote button creates two tags) closed

item.description:
invalid:

After testing with my FireFox extensions, disabling them all and then re-enabling them one-by-one, I found an extension that causes the WYSIWYG editor not to function correctly.

MR Tech Local Install 4.0 (​http://www.mrtech.com/extensions/)

I am going to report to the ext. developer what happens.

item.title: Ticket #2179 (Categories Missing / Removed) updated
item.dc:creator: jcwinnie
item.description:
from the forum:

Unable to detect a pattern. I do have a large number of categories, so I will avoid reciting the list. The ones I noticed missing were 1) architecture, 2) housing and 3) shelter.

I also note that when I use performancing, those categories are present and I can select them like any others. Is quite odd.

Is there any sort of index that could have been corrupted? When I used PHP to add those categories to the post, I noted that the category table showed an overload, which disappeared when I optimized the table. Unfortunately, this failed to solved the problem.

Sorry, when I copied the php, uploaded it to the remote server, and activated the plugin, I got garbage at the top of the page until I deactivated the plugin again.

BTW: If you really need to see all of my categories, my profile includes my weblog, which would show my categories in the sidebar. Architecture has 11 posts, housing (9) and shelter (10).

item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: Owner, Priority, Status, Severity, Milestone changed

item.title: Ticket #2179 (Categories Missing / Removed) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
Actually, it would be better to use the forum for this discussion. Once we've found the root of this problem we can sort out a patch and everything here.

​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/53873?replies=1

item.title: Ticket #2179 (Categories Missing / Removed) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
Odd... never heard of anything like that. Could you install the dump environment plugin: ​http://dev.wp-plugins.org/file/dump_env/trunk/dump_env.php?rev=4235 and tell us the output. The Categories box is set to a maximum height and has a scrollbar so you can get to the lower categories, so could that be your problem?

Can you work out any pattern to which categories are missing? Could you list _exactly_ which categories are in your DB and which ones aren't showing up?

item.title: Ticket #2182 (TinyMCE (rich text editor) Tooltips are wrong in Mac Browsers) created
item.dc:creator: alexkingorg
item.description: Macs don't have ALT keys, CTRL is the meta key for accesskeys on the Mac. Need a browser detect branch in the code to show the proper meta key in the tooltip.

item.title: Ticket #2181 (There needs to be a get_comments_rss_link) created
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: Currently, using default template tags, you can only output an RSS anchor, you can't get and output the RSS link itself. This is a problem if you for instance want to add a class to the anchor. Also, the comments_rss_link template tag could do with 'before' and 'after' parameters.

item.title: Ticket #2133 (No Cut & Paste When Editing using Opera (on Linux)) updated
item.dc:creator: jcwinnie
item.description: Occurs in 2.0, too, Browse Happy People!

item.title: Ticket #2180 (Closed comments doesn't surround the output of comments_popup_link ...) created
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: When using comments_popup_link, the fourth parameter sets the class of the link around the comments. However, if the comments are closed on an entry, no class is set. It would perhaps be preferable if there was a 'before' and 'after' parameter set, so one could surround the comment with a span or something similar.

item.title: Ticket #2179 (Categories Missing / Removed) created
item.dc:creator: jcwinnie
item.description:
From either Write or Edit, some catergories are missing from the selectable with checkbox list of categories, to include Uncategorized. Occurence with either Firefox or Opera on Linux and Win98 systems, so one might assume that someone borked it to undertand it.

Restored functionality would be appreciated by someone using WP daily throughout the day. Thanks.

item.title: Ticket #2166 (# in uploaded image filename breaks uploader) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Status changed

wp-admin/admin-functions.php line 1752 is the only place that needs rawurlencode. However, when I test in FF and IE, %23 is in the src and href but the browser decodes it and puts # in the request, which of course gets a 404.

I think it would be better to replace # with _

item.title: Ticket #2130 (wp_kses kills < !-- more --> from xmlrpc posted entries) updated
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description:
Can you fix this by adding a ? to the regex in the first replacement block? Like:

return preg_replace('%(<!--.*?-->)|(<'.# EITHER: <

item.title: Ticket #2149 (Historical Dates (Pre 1901) Unsupported in Wordpress ) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description: Priority changed

item.title: Ticket #2157 (Published Articles for Future Appearance Get Counted in Categories) closed
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
wontfix:

This can't be done with WordPress' current setup. When setting category_count, we can discount future posts, but as, currently, no events can be triggered when a future post is published, we can't decrement it then. There are bugs to get a scheduler (see #1637) built into WP, so this is another reason why that would be a good thing :)

item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description: Now that WordPress 2.0 has a "My Account" link in the top right that points to profile.php, the "Users" top-level menu item should link to users.php.

item.title: Ticket #2172 (Private posts and unapproved comments show up in RSS feeds.) closed
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
worksforme:

Hmm... actually I can't replicate either parts of this in 1.5.2. I asked in #wordpress and got someone else (pwaring) with a 1.5.2 to test, he couldn't replicate either. Closing with worksforme.

By the way, when you want to 'publish' a private post, you have to hit 'Save' instead of 'Publish' (hitting Publish causes it to be a public post), perhaps that's the problem?

item.title: Ticket #2172 (Private posts and unapproved comments show up in RSS feeds.) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description: In 2.0 (our current stable release), neither private posts nor unapproved comments show up in feeds. So this is not a bug in 2.0. Not closing as this could be a candidate for backporting if we release a new version on the 1.5 branch.

item.title: Ticket #2160 (get_post_custom_values() broken?) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse

item.title: Ticket #2159 (Comment Counter off again) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Some old comment plugins like Spam Karma 2 will do this. Repeat: versions of Spam Karma 2 that haven't specifically been updated to be compatable with WP 2.0 WILL mess up your comment counts.
